intro: Trachymene ericoides var. typica, commonly known as the pink trachymene, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from spring to autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to native gardens. Its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators make it a valuable plant in ecological landscaping.
